section.name: A container for CLI
section.p: Avalon Castle is the last one of a few attempts to deliver a container for the CLI (.Net and Mono) world. Although it can be viewed as a port of Avalon, it benefits from several features offered by the CLR.

Other important difference of Castle container is its simplicity. Based on Microkernel pattern, the user can easily modified, extend or adapt it to match his requirements. No hard contracts, no obligations. Just good and old Inversion of Control and stills Avalon.

section.name: What's different?
section.p: The first difference to be noticed relates to no obligation of using Avalon interfaces or attributes at all.
